data.title: Food fit for a King
data.text: The food at Village square is to die for.  The variety can't be beat by most restaurants in the Tunica and Memphis area.

data.title: Seafood Night (Friday) is the best
data.text: This used to be the BEST casino and buffet in the area. But it seems to have fallen from grace somewhat. The decor could stand a little freshening up.  If you go, Friday is the best night, which is seafood night. They have the biggest selection of all the casinos in the area. It is a nice buffet with variety, including pizza, prime rib, chicken, crawfish(when in season) and lots of veggies and salads and the desserts are EXCELLENT.  The bread pudding is to die for and the peach cobbler is AWESOME!  All of the desserts are good and very eye pleasing too. They have gumbo and soups and ice cream too!  It is pricey but if you eat a lot, I guess you get your money's worth. It is about $26. a piece last time I went (plus drinks).  If you get beer- it is extra.  They have good mashed potatoes too- southern style with lumps and lots of butter.

data.title: Allot to choose from
data.text: Used to be the best in town as far as casinos went.  Tied for 2nd now.  Shrimp not firm, and fried fish had a musty taste.  Ribs aren't tender.  Veggies are good though.

data.title: Best fried Catfish
data.text: This buffet has the best fried catfish in town and if you like fried pork chops please stop in sit down and enjoy yourself. Oh and by the way they have  any and all the desserts you could possibly want.

data.title: Typical buffet with a good selection and style
data.text: They have a wide variety of foods from American to Asian even pizza so for those picky eaters you should find something.  Deserts were also very good

data.title: Friends visit
data.text: Met some friends here for brunch. Food is ok. Lots to choose from, but the boiled shrimp were very small. The cinnamon roll was too dry. Not worth the money to me.

data.title: Lunch at the Horseshoe
data.text: It was raining cats and dogs so we decided to park in the Horseshoe parking garage and eat at the buffet. The menu choices are extravagant and I decided on the snow crab legs. That had them chilled or steamed along with shrimp. They even had crackers and butter for dipping. After three plates I called it a day. Well, after I had some peach cobbler a la mode.

data.title: Good
data.text: Variety of food. Enjoyed the variety of salads and the presentation was good. People eat with their eyes!

data.title: Seafood Buffet
data.text: The buffet was okay with just the normal items for a buffet.  Nothing extraordinary sine we were pretty much ignored since we did no sign up for the club card.

data.title: Really Good Buffet
data.text: We always enjoy this Buffet.  They have a very good selection to suit any appetite.  The waitstaff is very attentive and the Harrah's comp system makes it a great choice for any meal.

data.title: Name has changed to "The Spread" - food quality no better.
data.text: Years ago, the buffet was fabulous with plenty of well prepared choices, but the last several times we have eaten here we have been very disappointed.  If you don't care for seafood, do not visit on Friday or Saturday, because there are very few other choices.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: We were not going to try the buffet because it was almost $22 per person.  However, we learned of a secret word that gave us 50% off.  That was good because at that it was overpriced.  The food was overcooked and little flavor.  They had shrimp and crab claws but the crab claws were so overcooked that you couldn't get the meat out because it was cooked to the shell.  Service was average at best and looked like they would prefer to be doing something else.  It is convenient when staying at the casino, but the price and quality of food make it something you have to think about before eating there.

data.title: Nice Varity
data.text: We always like eating here due to the varity and the quality of the food; it's still a little over priced, but most Casino Buffets are.  The service was prompt and we never had to ask for refills.

data.title: Horseshoe Buffet
data.text: Was much better when Jack Binion still owned the joint.   Harrah's remodeled it and changed the name to something else and much of the food selection was reduced by some new action stations (custom pannini,  steak thingy,  etc).  I don't know what to tell you ,  the food and selection just isn't as good and often isn't complimentary to each other (i.e., lots of items but many wind up redundant or just don't mean anything to me).

data.title: This place needs help
data.text: Food is just not very good. Nice layout and good service but the food is very blah and unexciting. They charge enough that it should be a much higher quality. Maybe they can get Paula Dean to overhaul it.

data.title: good eating
data.text: This restaurant is not called the Village Square Buffet anymore. It's called the Spread. I usually don't do buffet style restaurants. Its something about all the food mixed together. Not really agreeing with my stomach. But me and my mom went on March 5, 2013. This place is GREAT. We went for lunch. The food was hot. And it was a big variety. They had a seafood bar, pizza bar, bread bar, dessert bar..... The meat choices where good and plentiful. The had barbeque chicken, backed chicken, grilled chicken, brisket, ham.... The had something called Johnny Cakes(they are like pancakes but for Dinner). I really enjoyed myself. The Baked beans where to die for. I would recommend this place to all my friends.

data.title: Great staff, great good destroyed by salt and cheap margarine
data.text: I'm very sad to report that this buffet caters to local dirt farmers and hillbillies both of whom are clueless when it comes to adding salt and margarine to food to the point of ruining what was at one time good food.  If you like your omelet draped in cheap school cafeteria melted plastic (aka margarine), and fake imitation cheese food product, this is the place for you! You will also find your oatmeal swimming in margarine along with the imitation eggs (also doused in margarine). The hash browns are soaked in Crisco and even the bacon is cooked with additional lard (no joke).  The lunch and dinner items contain enormous amounts of salt and ruin the flavor of almost everything. I love buffets and good butter fat, but cheap Crisco and margarine along with everything loaded with too much salt makes this place a horrible choice.

data.title: Go for the Bread Pudding!
data.text:
Arriving in Shreveport, during our motor cycle trip, we opted to travel a few more miles to eat at the Village Square Buffet.  It's located in the Horse Shoe Casino.  I had eaten there before when passing through and I was impressed with the quality of the food but when I sampled the desserts the bread pudding blew my socks off! 
We arrived and discovered the restaurant had been complete remodeled and it appeared to me to have been expanded.  The variety of foods offered was mind boggling.  I asked and was told that yes they still had their bread pudding that I had been talking about since the beginning of the trip.  We paid and went straight for the dessert bar.  The three of us loaded up  a bowl apiece and started in on our bread pudding.  This drew a few giggles from a few folks but what the heck, I'd been expounding on how great the dessert was for more than 3 days and to say we were not disappointed is an understatement!  We emptied our bowl then cruised the area to select our dinner fare.  The selection was unbelievable and everything we tried tasted fantastic.  Of course after sampling almost everything offered, to include a beautiful salad bar, we had to have one more bowl of that wonderful bread pudding.  So, as we "waddled" out we knew we had made the right decision and made plans to visit the Horse Shoe, Village Square Buffet again, soon.

data.title: Worst
data.text: The line for the breakfast area was 40 people long and they only had 1 serving station open with 2 pans making eggs. We asked for our money back and left.

data.title: Awesome
data.text:
The food was delicious with a wide variety to choose from. For those of us not from the area and wanting to try the louisiana cuisine, it was a great experience. I enjoyed being able to try mudbugs and gumbo
without having to order it from a menu. It was a very enjoyable and filling experience.
